edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.editor

Class GTabbedPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTabbedPane
            • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.gui.editor.GTabbedPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class GTabbedPane
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    This class handles everything related to the tabs at the top of the text window. A tabbed panel is created when a file is opened or when the tab with an empty algorithm/graph icon is selected. A panel is removed by clicking it's x icon -- mouseClicked() method. A panel is selected via the stateChanged method. If there are no other panels, there will always be one for an empty graph.
    Author:
    Michael Owoc, radically simplified by Matthias Stallmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    To do:
    The dialog for closing a dirty tab should also be invoked when quitting Galant. It works with the menu but not with Command/Alt-Q.

      • GTabbedPane

        public GTabbedPane()

    • Method Detail

      • addEmptyAlgorithm

        public void addEmptyAlgorithm()
        Adds a tab for an empty algorithm. Only one empty graph at a time is allowed.

      • addEmptyGraph

        public void addEmptyGraph()
        Adds a tab for an empty graph; the pane contains wrapper GraphML text to avoid a NullPointerException when the GraphMLParser tries to parse it tab is created or an algorithm is fired. Only one empty alogorithm at a time.

      • addEditorTab

        public GEditorPanel addEditorTab(java.lang.String filename,
                                 java.lang.String filepath,
                                 java.lang.String content,
                                 GTabbedPane.AlgorithmOrGraph type)
        Adds a new editor tab and the associated panel and returns the latter.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file whose contents are displayed (this is shown on the tab)
        filepath - the path to the directory containing the file
        content - the text contained in the file
        type - whether this is an algorithm or a graph

      • restoreLastState

        protected void restoreLastState()
        Attempt to reopen any previously edited files. Should only be called upon initialization.

      • serializeState

        protected void serializeState()
        Records the current files open in the editor. Should be called any time the number or nature of tabs changes. As a side effect, makes a note of the existence of empty graphs or empty algorithms.

      • removeEditorTab

        public void removeEditorTab(int index)
        Removes the tab and panel at the given index

      • removeEditorTab

        public void removeEditorTab(javax.swing.JPanel panel)
        Removes the tab associated with the given panel and the panel itself

      • getSelectedPanel

        public GEditorPanel getSelectedPanel()
        Returns:
        the selected panel, cast as GEditorPanel

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent arg0)
        The following is called whenever a tab is clicked. if index is 0 or 1, creates an empty algorithm or graph, respectively
        Specified by:
        stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
